summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding a scanning project for 28 Epstein-related boxes. The SDNY is coordinating with a vendor, Melkin Solutions, to scan the materials, and they are seeking permission for the vendor to take the boxes off-site to expedite the process.

persons.name: Weddle
persons.role: Person handling files for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who has been handling the files on the Florida end and will be looped into the coordination for the scanning project.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Document Scanning Project
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinates with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and a vendor, Melkin Solutions, to scan 28 boxes of Epstein-related materials.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: In September 2020, the SDNY was working to scan 28 boxes of Epstein-related materials held in the Southern District of Florida.
The scanning project involved a vendor named Melkin Solutions.
The SDNY requested permission for the vendor to take the boxes off-site to their office for faster processing.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative activity and evidence handling related to the Epstein case years after his death.
